page.title: 19HOUSING AND POPULATION
page.content: HOUSING. Housing in village is mixed. There are cottages and houses of the late Victorian era as well as more modern houses. Six almshouses were built in Station Road and are occupied at the present time. Most of the housing is privately owned, only about 20% being council owned. There does not appear to be any proposals to expand the village geographically but infill building may take place where space permits. This can be seen in the current development of housing for the elderly on the site of the old Aspley Heath School which closed in l981. POPULATION. The Census Returns for l98l show the population to be 2173 of which l646 were over the age of 16.At the time 967 were working and 42 were seeking work.(Figures from Census l981 Small Area Statistics)
